intro: Aerva javanica var. javanica, commonly known as Java sida, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
